title: Overview of configuration files
text: Currently, PHG can use SQLite PostgreSQL store data pan-genomic graph. information data stored within database schema, please refer PHG Wiki.

title: Overview of configuration files
text: Access PHG database, regardless database type, requires configuration file. file contains various metadata needed access relevant PHG data /calculate optimal graph paths: example database configuration can found : SQLite example PostgreSQL example
code: host=localHost user=user password=password DB=/tempFileDir/outputDir/phgTestDB_mapq48.db DBtype=sqlite host=184.32.99.233:5422 user=user password=password DB=phgdb DBtype=postgres

title: Installing and setting up rPHG and rJava
text: Since PHG API written primarily Java, Java JDK need installed machine. Additionally, R communicate Java, R package rJava need installed. info rJava package can found . order load rJava properly, ensure : JDK (Java Development Kit ≥\geq8) installed system. system environment variable JAVA_HOME configured appropriately points JDK choice. usually included PATH environment variable well. Options system environmental variables available R can seen Sys.getenv() specifically Sys.getenv("JAVA_HOME"). NOTE: using UNIX system (e.g. Ubuntu) experiencing issues, may need reconfigure R Java. perform , open terminal enter command: may need root privileges performing may need add sudo prior command. need additional steps perform actions, detailed information can found using following links, depending OS: Linux macOS Windows
code: R CMD javareconf

title: Installing and setting up rPHG and rJava
text: rJava running machine, install latest version GitHub: package installed, load rPHG using: , want use function without violating environment can use rPHG::<function>, <function> rPHG function.
code: # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("maize-genetics/rPHG") library(rPHG)

title: Installing and setting up rPHG and rJava
text: Since certain analyses can possibly use lot computational resources, memory allocation rPHG can modified. change amount memory, use base options() function modify following parameter: Replace <memory> specified unit memory. example, want allocate maximum 6 GB memory operations, use input "-Xmx6g", g stands gigabyte (GB). information memory allocation can found .
code: options(java.parameters = c("-Xmx<memory>", "-Xms<memory>"))

title: Installing and setting up rPHG and rJava
text: Since rPHG package interface PHG API, can track internal API progress via logging file. file beneficial debugging, tracking, reproducing progress workflow. start logging file, use following command: startLogger() parameters set NULL, logging file created current working directory. unsure working directory R, use base getwd() command.
code: startLogger(fullPath = NULL, fileName = NULL)

what: Problems installing rJava M1/M2/Mnn CPU architecture (macOS)
title: Installing and setting up rPHG and rJava
text: running issues installing rJava using newer Mac chip architecture, Oracle JDK currently (writing ) work. Consider alternative JDK source OpenJDK Azul JDK. detailed information possible workaround can found Stack Overflow post.

what: Problems with rJava if you have upgraded Java (macOS)
title: Installing and setting up rPHG and rJava
text: using macOS, previously rJava working RStudio, upgraded Java now longer works, try following: command line type: check left symbolic link via: link exists, remove , create fresh via commands: now able enter RStudio setup rJava.
code: R CMD javareconf ls -ltr /usr/local/lib/libjvm.dylib rm /usr/local/lib/libjvm.dylib sudo ln -s $(/usr/libexec/java_home)/lib/server/libjvm.dylib /usr/local/lib

title: Installing and setting up rPHG and rJava
text: using UNIX system (e.g. Ubuntu) experiencing issues, may need reconfigure R Java. perform , open terminal enter command: may need root privileges performing may need add sudo prior command:
code: R CMD javareconf sudo R CMD javareconf

title: Introduction to rPHG
text: PHG databases can connected two primary sources: local server Local connections databases set use PostgreSQL SQLite management systems, typically located either local machine hosted high performance compute cluster accessed via PHG API. Conversely, server connections databases served publicly available web services leveraging Breeding API (BrAPI) endpoints data retrieval. example, demo.hub.maizegenetics.net publicly available PHG database housing information many known diversity populations maize.

title: Introduction to rPHG
text: set local connection, prior knowledge configuration files set needed. like information topic, please see vignette “Overview configuration files” can supply path valid configuration file constructor, PHGLocalCon(): , configuration file path (configFilePath) parsed create object type PHGLocalCon.
code: configFile |> PHGLocalCon() ## A PHGLocalCon connection object ##  ❯ Host......: localhost ##  ❯ DB Name...: phg_smallseq_test.db ##  ❯ DB Type...: sqlite

title: Introduction to rPHG
text: like use PHG web service, can use following similar method: , URL pointing PHG web service supplied constructor PHGServerCon() parsed create object type PHGServerCon.
code: "phg.maizegdb.org" |> PHGServerCon() ## A PHGServerCon connection object ##  ❯ Host............: phg.maizegdb.org ##  ❯ Server Status...: 200 (OK)

title: Introduction to rPHG
code: configFile |>      PHGLocalCon() |>      showPHGMethods() ## # A tibble: 4 × 3 ##   type_name method_name              description       ##   <chr>     <chr>                    <list>            ## 1 PATHS     B73Ref_method_PATH       <named list [1]>  ## 2 PATHS     anchorwave_assembly_PATH <named list [1]>  ## 3 PATHS     GATK_PIPELINE_PATH       <named list [1]>  ## 4 PATHS     PATH_METHOD              <named list [27]> configFile |>      PHGLocalCon() |>      PHGMethod("PATH_METHOD") ## A PHGMethod promise object: ##   <PHGLocalCon> --- <PATH_METHOD>

title: Introduction to rPHG
code: configFile |>      PHGLocalCon() |>      PHGMethod("PATH_METHOD") |>      readSamples() ##  [1] "LineA1_gbs"              "LineA1_wgs"              ##  [3] "LineA_gbs"               "LineA_wgs"               ##  [5] "LineB1_gbs"              "LineB1_wgs"              ##  [7] "LineB_gbs"               "LineB_wgs"               ##  [9] "RecLineA1LineA1gco2_gbs" "RecLineA1LineA1gco2_wgs" ## [11] "RecLineA1RefA1gco1_gbs"  "RecLineA1RefA1gco1_wgs"  ## [13] "RecLineALineB1gco3_gbs"  "RecLineALineB1gco3_wgs"  ## [15] "RecLineB1LineBgco7_gbs"  "RecLineB1LineBgco7_wgs"  ## [17] "RecLineB1RefA1gco4_gbs"  "RecLineB1RefA1gco4_wgs"  ## [19] "RecLineBLineB1gco5_gbs"  "RecLineBLineB1gco5_wgs"  ## [21] "RecLineBLineB1gco8_gbs"  "RecLineBLineB1gco8_wgs"  ## [23] "RecRefA1LineBgco6_gbs"   "RecRefA1LineBgco6_wgs"   ## [25] "RefA1_gbs"               "RefA1_wgs"               ## [27] "Ref_gbs"                 "Ref_wgs"

title: Introduction to rPHG
code: configFile |>      PHGLocalCon() |>      PHGMethod("PATH_METHOD") |>      readRefRanges() ## GRanges object with 10 ranges and 1 metadata column: ##        seqnames      ranges strand |       rr_id ##           <Rle>   <IRanges>  <Rle> | <character> ##    [1]        1      1-3000      * |          R1 ##    [2]        1   6501-9500      * |          R2 ##    [3]        1 13001-16000      * |          R3 ##    [4]        1 19501-22500      * |          R4 ##    [5]        1 26001-29000      * |          R5 ##    [6]        1 32501-35500      * |          R6 ##    [7]        1 39001-42000      * |          R7 ##    [8]        1 45501-48500      * |          R8 ##    [9]        1 52001-55000      * |          R9 ##   [10]        1 58501-61500      * |         R10 ##   ------- ##   seqinfo: 1 sequence from an unspecified genome; no seqlengths

title: Introduction to rPHG
code: configFile |>      PHGLocalCon() |>      PHGMethod("PATH_METHOD") |>      readPHGDataSet() ## class: PHGDataSet  ## dim: 10 28  ## metadata(0): ## assays(1): pathMatrix ## rownames(10): R1 R2 ... R9 R10 ## rowData names(1): rr_id ## colnames(28): RecLineB1RefA1gco4_wgs RecLineB1RefA1gco4_gbs ... ##   RecLineA1RefA1gco1_wgs RecLineA1RefA1gco1_gbs ## colData names(0):

title: Authors and Citation
text: Brandon Monier. Author, maintainer. Peter Bradbury. Author. Terry Casstevens. Author. Jean-Luc Jannink. Author. Ed Buckler. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Monier B, Bradbury P, Casstevens T, Jannink J, Buckler E (2025). rPHG: R front-end practical haplotype graph. R package version 0.2.3, https://rphg.maizegenetics.net/, https://github.com/maize-genetics/rPHG.
code: @Manual{,   title = {rPHG: R front-end for the practical haplotype graph},   author = {Brandon Monier and Peter Bradbury and Terry Casstevens and Jean-Luc Jannink and Ed Buckler},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.2.3,     https://rphg.maizegenetics.net/},   url = {https://github.com/maize-genetics/rPHG}, }

title: R front-end for the practical haplotype graph
text: rPHG system interact retrieve information Practical Haplotype Graph (PHG) - general, graph-based, computational framework genotype inference. accomplished leveraging Breeding PHG APIs.

title: R front-end for the practical haplotype graph
text: cite rPHG, please use following citation: Bradbury et al. (2022). Practical Haplotype Graph, platform storing using pangenomes imputation. Bioinformatics, 38(15), 3698–3702, https://doi.org/10.1093/bioinformatics/btac410

title: R front-end for the practical haplotype graph
text: experience working setting rJava R installation, recommended read long-form documentation. walkthrough can found . already fairly comfortable working Java JDK rJava, can follow following commands. Package source code can installed directly BitBucket repository using devtools package:
code: if (!require("devtools")) install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github(repo = "maize-genetics/rPHG")

title: Helper function to build HaplotypeGraph object — buildHaplotypeGraph
code: buildHaplotypeGraph(   phgMethodObj,   chrom = NULL,   includeSequence = FALSE,   includeVariants = FALSE )

title: Helper function to build HaplotypeGraph object — buildHaplotypeGraph
text: phgMethodObj PHGMethod object. chrom vector chromosomes include graph. NULL, defaults . specify multiple chromosome, pass vector strings (.e. c("1", "2", "3")). currently used haplotypes. includeSequence Whether include sequences haplotype nodes. currently used haplotypes. NOTE: greatly increase memory consumption! includeVariants Whether include variant contexts haplotype nodes. currently used haplotypes. NOTE: greatly increase memory consumption!

title: rPHG 0.2.3
text: Fixed issue variable evaluation plotDot() function

title: rPHG 0.2.2
text: Fixed issue DEMO method endpoint returning incorrect dimensional data specific Maize PHGv1 methods

title: rPHG 0.2.1
text: Creates dot plots .anchorspro files Creates summary metrics directory gVCF files

title: rPHG 0.2.0
text: Unified workflow local server instances New object connecting remote public PHG servers using BrAPI endpoints New object connecting local SQLite PostgreSQL database instances Wrapper PHG API Java graph object PHGMethod() showPHGMethods() readSamples() readRefRanges() readHaplotypeIds() readPHGDataSet() numHaploPerRefRange() calcMutualInfo() plotGraph() plotMutualInfo()

title: rPHG 0.1.18
text: Now returns method IDs graphs 100 samples data prevents publicly available testing methods displayed new PHG users.

title: rPHG 0.1.17
text: specified PHGMethod("DEMO") download small section (25 samples x 1000 reference ranges) Goodman/Buckler path data Useful testing demonstrations

title: rPHG 0.1.16
text: Returns visNetwork object given section PHG data filtered reference range Updated installation information README

title: rPHG 0.1.15
text: Returns tibble object taxa IDs found group haplotype IDs given set reference range IDs Update latest jar files including PHG build

title: rPHG 0.1.14
text: Update logging function (startLogger()) Add new tests expand code coverage Deprecate BrAPI calls use external khttp client PHG jar

title: rPHG 0.1.13
text: Update latest jar files including PHG build

title: rPHG 0.1.12
text: BrapiCon BrapiConPHG readRefRanges() readSamples() readTable() readPHGDatasetFromBrapi() filterRefRanges() filterSamples() serverInfo() availablePHGMethods() Added Kotlin methods improved data parsing speeds. buildType - want graph built paths haplotypes?

title: rPHG 0.1.11
text: Added NEWS file tracking version updates. Added error checks catching C stack usage errors configuration file checks functions require configuration file path parameters. Fixed edge cases plotNumHaplo() plotMutualInfo().
